channel.title: Command = mute
channel.description:
well, i have been trying to make this command for so long now..
some just mind helping me with this code

item.title: Command = mute
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

[quote=“KillinXxSMile, post:2, topic:269337”]Hmm this is a basic mute/unmute command now i haven’t actually tested this. it was just off my head… im 90% sure this will work…
also you don’t have to make it so its playerRights you can just have it so only your ip can do it
Example:
if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && connectFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(“127.0.0.1”)) {

or you could also have it so only your name can do it
Example:
if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("######")) {

if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights >= #) {
	try {
		String mutedName = command.substring(5);
		int mutedPlayer = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(mutedName);
		client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[mutedPlayer];
		m.silent = 1;
		sendMessage(mutedName+" #(ENTER MSG HERE)#");
		m.sendMessage("Staff member has muted you? #CHANGE THIS TO WHAT EVER#");
	}
	catch(Exception e) {
		sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want to permanently mute");
	}
}

Nd just in case you need…?

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && playerRights >= #) {
	try {
		String muted = command.substring(7);
		int playerMuted = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(muted);
		client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[playerMuted];
		m.silent = 0;
		m.tempmute = 0;
		m.sendMessage("A member of staff has lifted your mute, allowing you to talk again"); // change the msg if you feel the need
		sendMessage(muted+" is no longer permanently muted"); // again you can change the msg
	}
	catch(Exception e) {
		sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want to unmute");
	}
}

Hope this helped[/quote]Ya, I looked over it a little for ya, I didn’t find anything wrong. Good job

Read full topic

item.title: Command = mute
item.dc:creator: @KillinXxSMile KillinXxSMile
item.description:
@KillinXxSMile wrote:

Hmm this is a basic mute/unmute command now i haven’t actually tested this. it was just off my head… im 90% sure this will work…
also you don’t have to make it so its playerRights you can just have it so only your ip can do it
Example:
if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && connectFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(“127.0.0.1”)) {

or you could also have it so only your name can do it
Example:
if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("######")) {

if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights >= #) {
	try {
		String mutedName = command.substring(5);
		int mutedPlayer = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(mutedName);
		client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[mutedPlayer];
		m.silent = 1;
		sendMessage(mutedName+" #(ENTER MSG HERE)#");
		m.sendMessage("Staff member has muted you? #CHANGE THIS TO WHAT EVER#");
	}
	catch(Exception e) {
		sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want to permanently mute");
	}
}

Nd just in case you need…?

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && playerRights >= #) {
	try {
		String muted = command.substring(7);
		int playerMuted = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(muted);
		client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[playerMuted];
		m.silent = 0;
		m.tempmute = 0;
		m.sendMessage("A member of staff has lifted your mute, allowing you to talk again"); // change the msg if you feel the need
		sendMessage(muted+" is no longer permanently muted"); // again you can change the msg
	}
	catch(Exception e) {
		sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want to unmute");
	}
}

Hope this helped
